intro: Cardopatium vrionis, commonly known as the velvetleaf. This annual herbaceous plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It features heart-shaped, velvety leaves that are typically green with a slight pubescence. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Cardopatium vrionis is often found in disturbed soils and can become a weed in agricultural settings.
